Interface HangmanManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Hangman

    public interface HangmanManager
    A HangmanManager keeps track of the state of a game of hangman. Methods provide access to the current set of guesses, number of wrong guesses remaining, and the current pattern to be displayed to the user. The record method updates state by recording a new guess and updating the other values appropriately.

    Implementing classes are expected to include a constructor as follows. 

     public ClassName (final List<String> dictionary,
                   final int length,
                   final int wrongGuessLimit)
    • The dictionary parameter is a list of candidate words.
    • The length parameter is the length of a goal word.
    • The wrongGuessLimit parameter is the number of wrong guesses at which the player loses.
    • The constructor throws an IllegalArgumentException if length < 1, wrongGuessLimit < 1, or there is no word in the dictionary of the specified length.
    Version:
    1.4.3
    Author:
    Dr. Jody Paul

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      SortedSet<Character> guesses()
      Access the set of letters already guessed by the player.
      int guessesLeft()
      Access the number of wrong guesses that result in a loss for the player given the current state of the game.
      String pattern()
      Return the hangman-style display pattern of letters and dashes (with interpolated spaces) appropriate to the current state based on the letters already guessed and the goal.
      int record(char guess)
      Record state changes based on new letter guess.
      Set<String> words()
      Access the set of candidate words; if size == 1, contents are the actual goal word.
      int wrongGuessLimit()
      Access the limit on wrong guesses.

    • Method Detail

      • words

        Set<String> words()
        Access the set of candidate words; if size == 1, contents are the actual goal word.
        Returns:
        the goal word or the candidate goal words

      • wrongGuessLimit

        int wrongGuessLimit()
        Access the limit on wrong guesses.
        Returns:
        the number of wrong guesses that results in a player loss

      • guessesLeft

        int guessesLeft()
        Access the number of wrong guesses that result in a loss for the player given the current state of the game.
        Returns:
        the number of wrong guesses that would result in a loss

      • guesses

        SortedSet<Character> guesses()
        Access the set of letters already guessed by the player.
        Returns:
        the set of letters guessed by the player

      • pattern

        String pattern()
        Return the hangman-style display pattern of letters and dashes (with interpolated spaces) appropriate to the current state based on the letters already guessed and the goal.
        Returns:
        the hangman-style pattern to be displayed to the user
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if there is no goal word

      • record

        int record(char guess)
        Record state changes based on new letter guess.
        Parameters:
        guess - the letter being guessed [Precondition: guess must be lower-case letter] [Precondition: guess must not be among letters already guessed]
        Returns:
        the number of occurrences of the guessed letter in the goal
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if no guesses left or no goal word
        IllegalArgumentException - if letter is already guessed
